definition:
The tangent of may be defined by using whatever of the below three
characterisations.\
The is a line

-   whose distance from the centre of the circle is equal to the radius
    of the circle;

-   that is perpendicular to a radius of the circle and passes through
    the end point of the radius lying on the circumference;

-   that has only one common point with the curve.

**Note.** The tangent of ellipse may also be defined by using the third
characterisation.
